title: As WeWork’s plans for a market debut unravel, what are Softbank’s options?
text:
It started as one of SoftBank’s shrewdest bets but has rapidly become a thorn in its side.

WeWork, the US start-up that rents out shared workspaces, had its eyes on a blockbuster public listing this month before a quick succession of events threw its future into doubt.

Its charismatic founder Adam Neumann, who started the company nine years ago with a pledge to improve the world, was ousted as CEO on Monday. Its market debut, intended to raise urgently needed financing, was called off, until at least next year.

WeWork’s valuation has now fallen from $47bn to $10bn and there remain concerns over its strange corporate structure and obscure path to profit.

For Japanese technology giant SoftBank,...
description: It started as one of SoftBank’s shrewdest bets but has rapidly become a thorn in its side.
